SENTIENT SPECIES:
Blue Dwarfoids with Long Tails: Fond of drink and industry - especially building strange contraptions. They have blue skin. They have bilateral symmetry. They use their long tails for balance. They are cautious and believe in the survival of the fittest. They first evolved on Eemuv II in 2848.
	Their Stats are: STR: 1 DEX: -1 CON: 2 INT: 1 CHA: -2
Yellow Trolloids with Long Tails: They have lost the ability to reproduce naturally, and compensate for this with a focus on science and paranoia. They have yellow skin. They have bilateral symmetry. They use their long tails for balance. They are fond of practical jokes and have a complex system of social castes. They first evolved on Eikas I in 2869.
	Their Stats are: STR: 1 DEX: 1 CON: -2 INT: -1 CHA: -1
Tiny Antoids: Small, industrious and well-organised, these creatures' greatest weakness is their ever-ballooning population. They have bilateral symmetry. They are thrill-seeking and have a complex system of social castes. They first evolved on Hylus I in 2843.
	Their Stats are: STR: 2 DEX: -1 CON: 0 INT: 1 CHA: -1
Feathered Dwarfoids with Giant Eyes: Fond of drink and industry - especially building strange contraptions. They have bilateral symmetry. Their giant eyes take up most of their head. They are gregarious and strive to uphold their ideals of personal honour. They first evolved on Hylus I in 2860.
	Their Stats are: STR: -1 DEX: 0 CON: -1 INT: -1 CHA: 1
Slim Koboldoids: Eat pretty much anything, including one another. Disturbingly fond of skulls. They have bilateral symmetry and a slim shape. They are peaceful and believe in the survival of the fittest. They first evolved on Lumen III in 2882.
	Their Stats are: STR: -2 DEX: -2 CON: 1 INT: 1 CHA: -1
Giant Antoids: Small, industrious and well-organised, these creatures' greatest weakness is their ever-ballooning population. They have bilateral symmetry. They are meditative and believe in the survival of the fittest. They first evolved on Mycon I in 2881.
	Their Stats are: STR: 1 DEX: 2 CON: 2 INT: 1 CHA: -3
Two-Headed Trolloids with Giant Eyes: They have lost the ability to reproduce naturally, and compensate for this with a focus on science and paranoia. They have two heads that tend to constantly bicker with one another. They have bilateral symmetry. Their giant eyes take up most of their head. They are humorless and unwilling to compromise. They first evolved on Eikas I in 2828.
	Their Stats are: STR: 0 DEX: 0 CON: 1 INT: 2 CHA: 0
Feathered Purple Antoids: Small, industrious and well-organised, these creatures' greatest weakness is their ever-ballooning population. They have purple feathers. They have bilateral symmetry. They are hyperactive and believe in the inherent superiority of their species. They were uplifted by the Empire of Tiny Antoids on Bylox II in 2825.
	Their Stats are: STR: 1 DEX: -2 CON: 2 INT: -1 CHA: -2
Four-Armed Trolloids: They have lost the ability to reproduce naturally, and compensate for this with a focus on science and paranoia. They have four arms. They have bilateral symmetry. They are violent and believe that each individual must serve the community. They first evolved on Lumen III in 2847.
	Their Stats are: STR: 2 DEX: 1 CON: 0 INT: 0 CHA: 0
Scaly Trolloids: They have lost the ability to reproduce naturally, and compensate for this with a focus on science and paranoia. They have bilateral symmetry. They are gregarious and deeply rationalist. They first evolved on Lumen III in 2806.
	Their Stats are: STR: 1 DEX: -1 CON: 1 INT: 1 CHA: 1

CIVILISATIONS:
THE EMPIRE OF TINY ANTOIDS:
An ancient, corrupt, fantastically wealthy, highly advanced Empire of 23 planets, with 45 billion inhabitants.
Major populations:
7 billion Tiny Antoids.
4 billion enslaved Blue Dwarfoids with Long Tails.
4 billion enslaved Yellow Trolloids with Long Tails.
2 billion enslaved Feathered Dwarfoids with Giant Eyes.
3 billion enslaved Slim Koboldoids.
6 billion enslaved Giant Antoids.
7 billion enslaved Two-Headed Trolloids with Giant Eyes.
8 billion enslaved Feathered Purple Antoids.
3 billion enslaved Four-Armed Trolloids.
1 billion enslaved Scaly Trolloids.

	Their Stats are: STR: -1 DEX: 0 CON: -2 INT: 0 CHA: -2
PLANETS:
ATRIA IV
A life-bearing planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
It is populated by:
1 billion enslaved Giant Antoids
1 billion enslaved Two-Headed Trolloids with Giant Eyes
A science lab, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2783
Vast Canyons: Gashes in the planet's crust so deep they reach the hot mantle, emitting gases noxious to much life but highly nutritious to some.
Strata:
The ruins of a military base, built by the Third Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2609, destroyed in 2770 due to orbital bombardment by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots.
A Killer Meme created by the rogue AI Simulation 432 in 2396, forgotten in 2724.
Remnants of a culture of Scaly Ursoids with Threefold Symmetry that collapsed due to a series of volcanic eruptions in 2413.
Remnants of a culture of Green Trolloids that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2253.
Remnants of a culture of Green Trolloids that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2206.

TABERNAK V
A barren planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
In orbit: The rogue AI Simulation 183.
A military base, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2784
Vast Empty Plains: Brown, dusty and featureless, their monotony is broken only by the occasional rivulet around which cluster many flying animals.
Vast Canyons: Gashes in the planet's crust so deep they reach the hot mantle, emitting gases noxious to much life but highly nutritious to some.
Strata:
Remnants of a culture of Giant Robots that collapsed due to a massive asteroid impact in 2709.
Remnants of a culture of Amorphous Deep Dwellers that collapsed due to a massive asteroid impact in 2709.
Remnants of a culture of Scaly Ursoids with Threefold Symmetry that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2702.
The wreck of the flagship of Captain Subroutine 12-a/x, destroyed by the rogue AI Simulation 125.
Remnants of a culture of Giant Robots that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2692.
Remnants of a culture of Giant Robots that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2664.
The ruins of a military base, built by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids in 2544, destroyed in 2548 during the invasion of the Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots.
A Mind Archive created by the Fifth Church of Flying White Robots in 1452, hidden in 1526.

DYLOW IV
A barren planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
It is a little polluted.
A science lab, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2777
A painting of Simulation 183 created by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2670
Ice Planet: Nearly the entire planet is covered in a thick sheet of ice.
Poison World: Mineral deposits produce a steady stream of toxins that makes survival extremely difficult.
Beaufiful Aurorae: The solar wind makes bright displays of flickering green at the planet's poles.
Strata:
The ruins of a mining base, built by the Church of Robots, Ursoids, Humanoids and Deep Dwellers in 2724, destroyed in 2726 during the collapse of the Church of Robots, Ursoids, Humanoids and Deep Dwellers.
The ruins of a mining base, built by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids in 2628, destroyed in 2634 during the invasion of the Third Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots.
The ruins of a city of spires, built by the Third Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2605, destroyed in 2622 due to nanospores relased by Mind 62.
The ruins of a complex of arcologies, built by the Third Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2569, destroyed in 2622 due to nanospores relased by Mind 62.
Remnants of a culture of Flying Blue Robots with Long Tails that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2586.
The ruins of a grand palace, built by the Third Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2555, destroyed in 2584 through orbital bombardment by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids.
The ruins of a repair bay, built by the Third Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2553, destroyed in 2584 through orbital bombardment by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids.
Remnants of a culture of Giant Robots that collapsed due to orbital bombardment by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids in 2584.
Remnants of a culture of Giant Robots that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2576.
Remnants of a culture of Green Trolloids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2327.
Remnants of a culture of Slim Robots that collapsed by a time vortex in 1146.
The ruins of a barracks, built by the Church of Scaly Ursoids with Threefold Symmetry in 2230, destroyed in 2286 during the invasion of the Second Church of Slim Robots.
Remnants of a culture of Scaly Ursoids with Threefold Symmetry that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2135.

EUMIS II
A barren planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
A military base, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2824
Periodical Darkness: Every thirteen years, the orbit of this planet synchronizes with that of a planet closer to its stars, causing a night that lasts for weeks.
Vast Canyons: Gashes in the planet's crust so deep they reach the hot mantle, emitting gases noxious to much life but highly nutritious to some.
Strata:
Remnants of a culture of Scaly Ursoids with Threefold Symmetry that collapsed through predation by ultravores in 2791.
Remnants of a culture of Slim Deep Dwellers that collapsed through predation by ultravores in 2786.
The ruins of a vast museum, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2735, destroyed in 2758 .
The ruins of a city of spires, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2733, destroyed in 2758 .
The ruins of a reforming vat, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2728, destroyed in 2758 .
Remnants of a culture of Amorphous Deep Dwellers that collapsed from the Black Death in 2758. The Black Death, which affects Amorphous Deep Dwellers, slumbers in their corpses.
The ruins of a grand palace, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2715, destroyed in 2724 through orbital bombardment by the Fifth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots.
The ruins of a repair bay, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2716, destroyed in 2722 through orbital bombardment by the Church of Robots, Ursoids, Humanoids and Deep Dwellers.
The ruins of a orbital elevator, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2661, destroyed in 2722 through orbital bombardment by the Church of Robots, Ursoids, Humanoids and Deep Dwellers.
The ruins of a grand palace, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2672, destroyed in 2714 through orbital bombardment by the pirate Grey Node.
The ruins of a repair bay, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2648, destroyed in 2714 through orbital bombardment by the pirate Grey Node.
Remnants of a culture of Giant Robots that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2690.
The ruins of a military base, built by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids in 2618, destroyed in 2643 due to orbital bombardment by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids.
The ruins of a military base, built by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids in 2597, destroyed in 2616 due to orbital bombardment by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids.
Remnants of a culture of Flying White Robots that collapsed due to a psionic shockwave in 1611.

EUNIT III
A life-bearing planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
It is populated by:
2 billion enslaved Four-Armed Trolloids
A military base, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2841
Periodical Darkness: Every thirteen years, the orbit of this planet synchronizes with that of a planet closer to its stars, causing a night that lasts for weeks.
Ice Planet: Nearly the entire planet is covered in a thick sheet of ice.
Lifeforms of note:
Pharmaceuticals: Plants that contain interesting chemical compounds with medical applications.
Living islands: Composed of the shells of millions of small crustaceans, each of these floating islands hosts its own unique ecosystem.
Shape-shifters: A predatory creature able to mimic any other, even a sentient one.
Strata:
A block of time ice, encasing Unit 12-a/x, Autarch of the Second Church of Giant Robots created by the rogue AI Simulation 201 in 2810, buried in 2839.
Remnants of a culture of Scaly Deep Dwellers with Giant Eyes that collapsed due to orbital bombardment by the Third Church of Giant Robots in 2839.
Remnants of a culture of Yellow Dwarfoids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2834.
The ruins of a vast museum, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2782, destroyed in 2787 through predation by ultravores.
The ruins of a complex of arcologies, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2781, destroyed in 2787 through predation by ultravores.
The ruins of a repair bay, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2757, destroyed in 2787 through predation by ultravores.
The ruins of a vast underground vault, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2752, destroyed in 2787 through predation by ultravores.
Remnants of a culture of Giant Robots that collapsed through predation by ultravores in 2787.
The ruins of a science lab, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2665, destroyed in 2745 due to orbital bombardment by the Second Kingdom of Robots and Ursoids.
Remnants of a culture of Giant Robots that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2735.
Remnants of a culture of Amorphous Yellow Robots that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2735.
The Tomb of Captain Subcomponent 039, buried in 2700.
The ruins of a repair bay, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2659, destroyed in 2664 by a nanofungal bloom.
Remnants of a culture of Amorphous Yellow Robots that collapsed due to a nanofungal bloom in 2664.
Remnants of a culture of Amorphous Yellow Robots that collapsed through the actions of the Third Republic of Giant Robots in 2656.
Remnants of a culture of Scaly Ursoids with Threefold Symmetry that collapsed due to orbital bombardment by the pirate Purple Node in 2641.
The ruins of a vast museum, built by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids in 2627, destroyed in 2629 through orbital bombardment by the Third Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots.
Remnants of a culture of Scaly Ursoids with Threefold Symmetry that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2619.
The ruins of a reforming vat, built by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids in 2615, destroyed in 2618 through orbital bombardment by the Third Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots.
Remnants of a culture of Scaly Ursoids with Threefold Symmetry that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2586.
Fossils of gas bags that went extinct in 2562 due to a massive asteroid impact.

Remnants of a culture of Scaly Ursoids with Threefold Symmetry that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2467.
Remnants of a culture of Amorphous Yellow Robots that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2467.
Remnants of a culture of Giant Robots that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2386.
Remnants of a culture of Slim Robots that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2337.

Remnants of a culture of Blue Koboldoids that transcended the bounds of this universe in 1238.
The ruins of a vast underground vault, built by the Second Church of Immortal Blue Deep Dwellers in 928, destroyed in 1031 .

DILAX II
A life-bearing planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
A mining base, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2645
Gem World: Huge, beautiful gems many metres across can be found in caves and in veins.
Gigantic Cave Network: Thousands of kilometres of partially submerged caves riddle the crust of this planet. Very easy to get lost or hide in.
Strata:
Remnants of a culture of Feathered Purple Antoids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2873.
Remnants of a culture of Scaly Deep Dwellers with Giant Eyes that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2838.

EIKAS I
A life-bearing planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
It is populated by:
4 billion enslaved Yellow Trolloids with Long Tails
A mining base, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2793
Vast Canyons: Gashes in the planet's crust so deep they reach the hot mantle, emitting gases noxious to much life but highly nutritious to some.
Lifeforms of note:
Beautiful flying creatures: Fluttering fliers that display a dazzling array of colours.
Ocean giants: Huge sea creatures growing to more than a kilometre of length.
Ultravores: The ultimate apex predator, the Ultravore is capable of stalking and killing even the most intelligent and well-armed prey.
Strata:
Remnants of a culture of Feathered Koboldoids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2828.

EEMUV II
A life-bearing planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
It is populated by:
4 billion enslaved Blue Dwarfoids with Long Tails
A mining base, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2839
Deep Impenetrable Seas: Hundreds of kilometres down, water turns into ice from pressure.
Tidally Locked: This planet always presents the same side to its sun. There is perpetual day on one side, perpetual night on the other, and a ring of eternal twilight in between.

JURVOX II
A life-bearing planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
It is populated by:
6 billion Tiny Antoids
A mining base, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2776
Beaufiful Aurorae: The solar wind makes bright displays of flickering green at the planet's poles.
Gem World: Huge, beautiful gems many metres across can be found in caves and in veins.
Strata:
Remnants of a culture of Feathered Koboldoids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2836.
The ruins of a mining base, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2722, destroyed in 2762 due to orbital bombardment by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots.
Remnants of a culture of Scaly Ursoids with Threefold Symmetry that collapsed from the Orange Plague in 2748. The Orange Plague, which affects Scaly Ursoids with Threefold Symmetry, slumbers in their corpses.
Remnants of a culture of Amorphous Yellow Robots that collapsed from mass hysteria in 2717.

HYLUS I
A life-bearing planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
It is populated by:
2 billion enslaved Two-Headed Trolloids with Giant Eyes
A science lab, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2772
Musical Caves: The wind whistles through massive caves and across rocks, producing an eerie music.
Lifeforms of note:
Ultravores: The ultimate apex predator, the Ultravore is capable of stalking and killing even the most intelligent and well-armed prey.
Radiovores: These small worm-like creatures derive their energy directly from exposed deposits of radioactive materials.
Living islands: Composed of the shells of millions of small crustaceans, each of these floating islands hosts its own unique ecosystem.

VIM II
A barren planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
It is heavily polluted.
A mining base, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2795
Poison World: Mineral deposits produce a steady stream of toxins that makes survival extremely difficult.
Strata:
The Tomb of Captain Tkukk, buried in 2869.
The ruins of a mining base, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2767, destroyed in 2768 due to orbital bombardment by the Empire of Giant Robots.
The ruins of a mining base, built by the Church of Robots, Ursoids, Humanoids and Deep Dwellers in 2721, destroyed in 2726 during the collapse of the Church of Robots, Ursoids, Humanoids and Deep Dwellers.

BYLOX II
A life-bearing planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
It is populated by:
4 billion enslaved Feathered Purple Antoids
A vast museum, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2827
A city of spires, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2831
A orbital elevator, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2834
A complex of arcologies, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2836
A repair bay, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2837
Gigantic Cave Network: Thousands of kilometres of partially submerged caves riddle the crust of this planet. Very easy to get lost or hide in.
Deep Impenetrable Seas: Hundreds of kilometres down, water turns into ice from pressure.
Strata:
A painting of painting of Simulation 183 created by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2670 created by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2765, buried in 2824.

DELUW IV
A life-bearing planet of the Empire of Tiny Antoids.
It is populated by:
1 billion Tiny Antoids
A science lab, built by the Empire of Tiny Antoids in 2791
Gigantic Cave Network: Thousands of kilometres of partially submerged caves riddle the crust of this planet. Very easy to get lost or hide in.
Tidally Locked: This planet always presents the same side to its sun. There is perpetual day on one side, perpetual night on the other, and a ring of eternal twilight in between.
Strata:
Remnants of a culture of Yellow Trolloids with Long Tails that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2873.
Remnants of a culture of Giant Robots that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 2803.
The ruins of a military base, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2729, destroyed in 2761 due to orbital bombardment by the Empire of Giant Robots.
The ruins of a mining base, built by the Sixth Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2650, destroyed in 2726 during the collapse of the Church of Robots, Ursoids, Humanoids and Deep Dwellers.
A Virtual Reality Matrix created by the rogue AI Simulation 438 in 2572, buried in 2618.
The ruins of a mining base, built by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids in 2556, destroyed in 2618 due to orbital bombardment by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids.
The shattered wrecks of 2 spaceships of the fleet of Captain Unit 23/4432, destroyed by the rogue AI Simulation 438.


HISTORY:
0:
IN THE BEGINNING, ALL WAS DARK.
THEN, PLANETS BEGAN TO FORM:
Atria IV, Tabernak V, Dylow IV, Eumis II, Eunit III, Dilaw I, Dilax II, Kalamis V, Eikas I, Hylus II, Goneq VI, Duliq I, Eemuv II, Jurvox II, Hylus I, Cuniu III, Mycon I, Helmettepol IV, Lumen III, Lumen V, Vim II, Bylox II, Deluw IV
12:
Life arises on Eemuv II
16:
Life arises on Hylus I
18:
Life arises on Lumen III
19:
Life arises on Eunit III
20:
Life arises on Kalamis V
24:
Beautiful aurorae play across the skies of Kalamis V.
27:
Dylow IV becomes covered with ice.
Life arises on Vim II
29:
The wind plays across rock formations on Hylus I, producing an eerie music.
32:
Hylus II has become a poison world.
Shape-shifters evolve on Eemuv II.
39:
Due to an accident of orbital mechanics, every 13 years, Eumis II is plunged into total darkness.
43:
Life arises on Mycon I
45:
The wind plays across rock formations on Goneq VI, producing an eerie music.
47:
Ocean giants evolve on Kalamis V.
Sentient Feathered Catoids arise on Hylus I.
Sentient Slim Dwarfoids arise on Lumen III.
50:
Sentient Feathered Ursoids arise on Vim II.
54:
Brain parasites evolve on Eunit III.
56:
Deposits of huge gems form on Dilax II.
58:
Beautiful flying creatures evolve on Eemuv II.
59:
The Feathered Catoids on Hylus I mutate into Feathered Green Catoids.
Radiovores evolve on Kalamis V.
63:
Sentient Red Dwarfoids arise on Eunit III.
Sentient Telepathic Purple Koboldoids arise on Mycon I.
67:
The Feathered Green Catoids on Hylus I mutate into Feathered Orange Catoids.
Life arises on Eikas I
68:
The Slim Dwarfoids on Lumen III achieve spaceflight and organise as a Feudal State, the Kingdom of Slim Dwarfoids.

Civ Name: Second Republic of Tiny Trolloids 
Civ Birth Year: 193 
Civ Stats Str|Dex|Con|Int|Cha
          4 | 4 | 1 | 3 | -1 |

Civ Name: Republic of Amorphous Antoids with Giant Eyes 
Civ Birth Year: 239 
Civ Stats Str|Dex|Con|Int|Cha
          -2 | -4 | -2 | 2 | -2 | 
Resources 16 Science 0 Military 0 WeapLevel 0 TechLevel 1 Decrepitude 0
Slaves on Eunit III revolt, killing their oppressors and declaring the Free Republic of Amorphous Antoids with Giant Eyes.
The Church of Slim Dwarfoids attack Eunit III, a colony of the Republic of Amorphous Antoids with Giant Eyes, and subject it to orbital bombardment, killing 6 billion.
The rogue AI Mind 388 presents the inhabitants of Vim II with a gift: a Planet Destroyer.

Overcrowding on Lumen III leads to increased pollution.

The Republic of Robots and Antoids explore Vim II. They discover: Remnants of a culture of Amorphous Antoids with Giant Eyes that collapsed from the Orange Wasting in 337. The Orange Wasting, which affects Telepathic Purple Koboldoids, Tiny Trolloids, Green Antoids and Amorphous Antoids with Giant Eyes, slumbers in their corpses. They discover: Remnants of a culture of Amorphous Antoids with Giant Eyes that collapsed from the Orange Wasting in 327. The Orange Wasting, which affects Telepathic Purple Koboldoids, Tiny Trolloids, Green Antoids and Amorphous Antoids with Giant Eyes, slumbers in their corpses.  Unfortunately, they catch the Orange Wasting from their exploration of the ancient tombs, infecting Dilax II upon their return.They discover: Remnants of a culture of Green Antoids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 247. They discover: The ruins of a vast underground vault, built by the Empire of Slim Dwarfoids in 117, destroyed in 133 . They discover: Remnants of a culture of Feathered Ursoids that collapsed by a time vortex in 49.

The Republic of Robots and Antoids explore Dilaw I. They discover: The ruins of a mining base, built by the Second Church of Antoids in 304, destroyed in 313 due to orbital bombardment by the Second Church of Antoids. They discover: The ruins of a military base, built by the Empire of Slim Dwarfoids in 278, destroyed in 303 due to orbital bombardment by the Church of Antoids. They loot the Tomb of Captain Tkerlak. 
A famine breaks out on Hylus I, killing 13 billion.

They discover: Remnants of a culture of Green Antoids that collapsed from the Orange Wasting in 268. The Orange Wasting, which affects Telepathic Purple Koboldoids, Tiny Trolloids and Green Antoids, slumbers in their corpses.  Unfortunately, they catch the Orange Wasting from their exploration of the ancient tombs, infecting Mycon I upon their return.

They discover: The ruins of a cluster of breeding pits, built by the Third Empire of Green Antoids in 441, destroyed in 453 through orbital bombardment by the Kingdom of Antoids. They discover: Remnants of a culture of Green Antoids that collapsed from the effects of pollution in 369. 
The Third Empire of Green Antoids explore Lumen III. They discover: The ruins of a mining base, built by the Second Empire of Green Antoids in 470, destroyed in 475 due to orbital bombardment by the pirate Purple Antenna. They recover: A hymn about the President of the Third Republic of Antoids created by the Third Empire of Green Antoids in 462, buried in 469. They discover: The ruins of a repair bay, built by the Empire of Amorphous Antoids with Giant Eyes in 320, destroyed in 448 . They discover: Remnants of a culture of Tiny Trolloids that collapsed due to starvation in 222.

The Empire of Immortal Blue Deep Dwellers explore Atria IV. They discover: Remnants of a culture of Blue Koboldoids that collapsed due to a shift in the planet's orbital axis in 964. They recover: A block of time ice, encasing Tkkra, Emperor of the Third Empire of Green Antoids created by the rogue AI Experiment 331 in 534, hidden in 567.

Mass hysteria breaks out in the Church of Parasites, killing billions.
Overcrowding on Dylow IV leads to increased pollution.

They discover: The ruins of a military base, built by the Church of Scaly Ursoids with Threefold Symmetry in 2126, destroyed in 2137 during the invasion of the Empire of Green Trolloids.

They discover: The ruins of a city of spires, built by the Church of Giant Robots in 2661, destroyed in 2683 through orbital bombardment by the pirate Purple Node. They discover: The ruins of a vast museum, built by the Fourth Church of Robots, Trolloids, Catoids and Ursoids in 2608, destroyed in 2617 through orbital bombardment by the Third Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots. They discover: The ruins of a repair bay, built by the Third Church of Amorphous Yellow Robots in 2536, destroyed in 2587 .
